text: 9.2   Short Statements about Directed Graphs (a) True. Proof by contradiction. Assume G has no sources, ∀v ∈ V : degin(v) ≥ 1. Then we ﬁnd a topological sorting. Contradiction. This topological sorting has to start from a source but by assumption there are none. Furthermore, a topological sorting is possible if and only if the graph is a directed acyclic cycle. Contraposition of the fact that it doesn't implies that G contains a cycle. □ (b) False. Consider the following counter example. Observe that every vertex has even in-degree and out-degree, ∀v ∈ V : degin(v) ≡ 2 degout(v) ≡ 2 0. However, G does not contain a directed eulerian walk. 1 2 3 4 5 6 □ (c) True. A, B, C, F , D, H, I, G is a topological sorting. □ 9.4   Longest Path in DAG (a) #todo (b) #todo 9.5   DFS doesn't solve Eulerian Cycle (a) #todo (b) #todo
